contentrichtext.text: In [[telecommunication]], '''diurnal phase shift''' is the [[Phase (waves)|phase shift]] of electromagnetic signals associated with daily changes in the [[ionosphere]]. The major changes usually occur during the period of [[time]] when sunrise or sunset is present at critical points along the path. Significant phase shifts may occur on paths wherein a reflection area of the path is subject to a large tidal range. In [[cable]] systems, significant phase shifts can be occasioned by diurnal temperature variance. ==See also== *[[Terminator (solar)]] - "grey line" ==References== {{FS1037C MS188}} [[Category:Radio frequency propagation]] {{telecomm-stub}}
